p: Results of the antiproliferative evaluation of tested essential oil and of the doxorubicin, as referent drug are presented by (Fig. 1a,b, 2a,b). Essential oil of the T. vulgaris L. at 72 h after treatment had inhibitory potential on proliferation of tested cancer cells. The results of the antiproliferative activity suggested that T. vulgaris L. essential oil induced a dose-dependent inhibition of cell proliferation in all tested tumor cell lines, although each culture showed different sensitivity, in accordance to determined IC 50.
